headline: Nvidia Can Sell AI Chip to China Again After CEO Meets Trump
summary: Nvidia  said it has received assurances from the Trump administration that it can sell its H20 artificial-intelligence chip in China, days after Chief Executive  Jensen Huang  met President Trump.  The administration’s move marks a turnabout after the Commerce Department restricted sales of the chip in April, costing Nvidia billions of dollars.  The news came during a visit by Huang to Beijing, where he was meeting senior officials.

headline: Robinhood Misses Out on S&P 500. Why Analysts Are Still Upbeat.
summary: Despite missing out on a chance to join the  Robinhood Markets  has stellar quarterly results to look forward to, analysts say.  The online brokerage was passed over for including in the market benchmark late on Monday.  As of Monday’s close, Robinhood had a market valuation of $88.2 billion, more than double Trade Desk’s $37.1 billion.

headline: Stocks to Watch Tuesday: Nvidia, JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo
summary: ↗️ Nvidia (NVDA): The $4 trillion company said it had received assurances from the Trump administration it can sell its H20 artificial-intelligence chips in China. Shares rallied in premarket trade, as did other chip stocks, including Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), Broadcom (AVGO) and Micron Technology (MU).
